results.title: This is TVA
results.brief_description: Traces the development of the Tennessee Valley from its original state through the period when by bad farming the land was ruined to its present highly industrialised condition. The change has been brought about by the Tennessee Valley Authority, a Federal body with the power to build dams on the rivers in seven states. The rivers are now navigable at all seasons, hydro-electric power is available over large areas and there are chemical industries producing fertilisers and other agricultural products. The TVA has made possible these industries and brought huge areas back into production at a much higher level than formally.

results.title: This is Tokyo
results.brief_description: A survey of Tokyo showing the business and industrial centres, historic buildings like the Imperial Palace and Buddhist temples, the landscape gardens and the people who live and work in this huge city.

results.title: 3rd Ave El = Third Avenue El
results.brief_description: A dizzying, poetic ride through the city on an elevated railway that today exists only in memory. The El was noisy, ponderous and rickety - a leftover from earlier times, but by exploring the train, its passengers, movements, colours and images we find that it had its own unique beauty.

results.title: The Things we want to keep
results.creator_credit: Oliver Howes, Malcolm Otton, Australian Heritage Commission and Film Australia
results.brief_description: Looks at many of Australia’s historic buildings, towns, aboriginal sites, parks, flora and fauna. Shows some of the restoration work that has been done and encourages people to be aware of their heritage and to start thinking about change and the environment.

results.title: The Things people want
results.creator_credit: Jamison Handy and Jam Handy Organization
results.brief_description: Demonstrates how to sell in a competitive market with emphasis on the importance of product knowledge, creating the desire to own, getting the decision to buy and delivery of service or product. Six primary buyer’s interests are listed: comfort, safety, economy, performance, durability and appearance.

results.title: Then one year
results.brief_description:
Deals primarily with physiological changes in boys and girls at the onset of adolescence, and also to some extent with the worries and tensions of that period. Stresses that individual differences are normal variants.
Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.
